['Badge - Metal signifying police authority.', 'Handcuffs - Metal restraining device used by law enforcement officers.', "Shield - Often made of metal, it's a symbol of protection for those in policing roles.", 'Baton - A conductive baton often found with metallic parts, utilized as a defensive tool and compliance technique.', "Star Prismatic - The emblem on many police officers' hats made from metal or containing metal elements.", 'Metal Detector - Devices used by law enforcement to locate concealed weapons or contraband.', 'Breathalyzer - Contains metallic components, it is a tool used by officers for DUI checks.', 'Body Armor - Policemen often wear vests with metal plates for protection against bullets and shrapnel.', 'Bicycle Mounted Patrol (BMP) - Refers to police officers on bikes which may have metallic components in their construction.', 'Siren - Metal or part of a vehicle used by law enforcement, often loudly alerting the public about emergencies.', "Radio Transceiver - Often metal-cased, it's an essential communication tool for police officers on patrol.", "Duty Belt Pouches - Metal attachments or clasps are often found securing equipment on a policeman's duty belt.", 'Handheld Scanner - Metal and electronic device used by law enforcement to check IDs or licenses quickly.', 'Portable Light Bar - Mounted metal bar containing lights, typically affixed to the front of police vehicles.', 'Flashlight - A compact hand-held tool with metallic components, aiding officers in low light situations.', "Metal Badge Ring - The ring that holds a policeman's badge is usually metal.", 'K9 Unit Equipment - Some of the gear used by police dogs and their handlers can include metal elements.', 'Rifle - Often equipped with metallic components, it serves as part of the less-lethal or non-lethal arsenal in some jurisdictions.', 'Radar Gun - A handheld device used by officers to measure vehicle speeds; often contains metal parts for durability and function.', 'Patrol Vehicle Bumper - Typically made of reinforced metal, it serves as both a protective barrier and equipment mounting surface on police cars.']
